attributes.comment:
US Citizenship and Immigration Services
USCIS-2006-0044

I am against the proposed fee increase as it is written. The government is writing
this as a fix to internal problems of inefficiency and waste. This is also being done
at the cost of the tax payers who are suppose to be represented by the very same
people who wrote this.

The detailed breakdown of the costs reveals many of this issues that this agency
has to deal with. A 'cost to process' is listed, yet there is a short time that some
of these forms are good until. I am specifically referring to the I-600/600A, N-565,
N-600, and Biometric Services. These are all of the forms that are required for
international adoption. The wait times to be approved by an international adoption
agency is increasing. Since it is required to have these forms before you can be
approved, a person pays to have these completed up front. With the current wait
for China adoptions, we will have to renew this these two more times. If it costs to
process them, then why create your own problem by having them expire too soon?
This means that these costs are actually going to cost anyone currently adopting
over 300% more! Or better yet, why not just create a short form to extend the
forms and charge a small fee for the processing? There are better solutions other
than increasing the fees.

My recommendation is to rewrite this with two objectives. The first is to review and
change the expiration dates based on the reasons for filing these forms. As an
American citizen (born, raised and served in the military), how is it an issue of
national security that I want to adopt a child from abroad? The answer is it isn't.

The second objective, the fee structure should be based more on what you are
applying for and your status as a citizen at the time of application.

Finally, the Biometric Services does not make any sense. Fingerprints expire.
How is that? My fingerprints have been the same for 46 years! They do not
change. Plus, my fingerprints are in the system because of my military service. It
was flagged when I was fingerprinted for the adoption. Also, isn't technology
suppose to decrease costs? It does where I work. Another example of the
agencies ineffeciency.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Richard F. Bernier
